comments:

load class "org.eclipse.ajdt.internal.builder.Builder" from deactivated plugin
"org.eclipse.ajdt.ui"

Here is the stacktrace I see on the about window.

Some progress...

I have found a situation when using 'Rebuild All' that causes the builder to 
explode and this leads to the plugin being deactivated.  This occurs because of 
a locking issue in the compilation monitor code and only seems to occur when 
compiling multiple projects.  The compiler monitor correctly tracks the 
compilation of the first project, but then it attempts to update the task 
display with suitable output (e.g. any error messages) via a secondary thread 
(required as we have to be on the right thread to update the UI) and the system 
gets locks up.  This is because the thread to update the task view is waiting 
for the monitor dialog to finish and the monitor dialog is already receiving 
compilation information from compilation of the second project - the compiler 
monitor drops into a permanent loop trying to do some UI updates which can't 
occur until the former updates after the first compile have finished.

Egg<->Chicken  

Exiting this lockup situation deactivates the plugin.  I have fixed the loop, 
its now no longer permanent but am having trouble getting these threads to all 
run in the right order.  I'd like to update the task view once all the compiles 
have finished, but I don't think I know when that is.
---

With some rejigging, I have got the thread ordering to hang together ok.

I've committed the new CompilerMonitor and Builder - after some rather basic 
testing, but I haven't upgraded the binary download yet.

So rebuild all now works, and there are no hangs, so no need to prematurely 
kill the builder and so the plugin won't go deactivated.

Yuck, I hate threads and GUIs.  I won't mark this fixed until its been verified 
to fix the problem with more than my tiny amount of testing.  This may have to 
wait until there is a plugin binary of 0.5.1 available.
Plugin deactivation problems are heopfully now behind us!
